CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Solar cell devices were fabricated according to the structure ITO / PEDOT : PSS / photoactive ( polymer : PC 70 BM ) / TiO 2 / Al.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| photoactive ( polymer : PC 70 BM ) |
| TiO 2 |
| Al |

In this paragraph, the "Material Name" entities refer to the different materials used in the fabrication of solar cell devices. These materials include ITO (Indium Tin Oxide), PEDOT : PSS (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) polystyrene sulfonate), photoactive (polymer : PC 70 BM), TiO 2 (Titanium Dioxide), and Al (Aluminum).

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| polymer : PC 70 BM |
| TiO 2 |
| Al |

After reviewing the paragraph, I have identified the following "Material Name" entities: ITO, PEDOT : PSS, polymer : PC 70 BM, TiO 2, and Al. I have removed the term "photoactive" as it is a property of the material (polymer : PC 70 BM) rather than a material name itself.

The entities "ITO", "PEDOT : PSS", "TiO 2", and "Al" are clear examples of material properties. The entity "photoactive ( polymer : PC 70 BM )" is also a material property, as it refers to a photoactive polymer with a specific composition (PC 70 BM).
